titleStmt.title: Whereas it hath pleased almighty God to call to his mercy our late soveraign lord King Charles the Second of blessed memory, by whose decease the imperial crowns of England, Scotland, France and Ireland, are solely and rightfully come to the high and mighty Prince James, Duke of York and Albany ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament. House of Lords.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by the assigns of John Bill deceas'd, and by Henry Hills, and Thomas Newcomb ...,
by the heir of Andrew Anderson, printer to his most sacred Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Title from first lines of text.
Royal arms at head of text; initial letter.
Reproduction of the original in the National Library of Scotland.
